oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Martha White Biscuit Time - Milton Estes and his Musical Millers - 1947-02-22 - WSM
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: WSM program Martha White Biscuit time, originally broadcast on February 22, 1947 at 7:30 pm. Personnel include Louis Buck (announcer), Milton Estes (host, performer), Lew Childre (performer), and the Musical Millers (performers). Sponsored by Martha White. Opening theme music, 'How Many Biscuits Can You Eat'; closing theme music, 'How Many Biscuits Can You Eat'.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Milton Estes; Musical Millers; Lew Childre
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Opening statement (Louis Buck) (incomplete) -- Opening theme -- Louis Buck advertises Martha White flour -- Louis Buck introduces Milton Estes -- Milton Estes talks -- Jealous Heart (Milton Estes) -- Milton Estes talks -- Milton Estes introduces Lew Childre -- Lew Childre talks -- Truck Driver's Blues (Lew Childre) -- Milton Estes Talks -- Milton Estes and Louis Buck advertise Martha White flour -- Milton Estes talks -- A-Sleepin' At The Foot Of The Bed (Milton Estes) -- Milton Estes talks -- Jimmie Selph talks -- Midnight Flower (Milton Estes) [unconfirmed] -- Louis Buck advertises Martha White flour -- Closing statement (Milton Estes) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Louis Buck) (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Martha White biscuit time (Radio program); Estes, Milton, 1914-1963; Musical Millers (Musical group); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Childre, Lew, 1901-1961;
